links.title: Senate averts government shutdown with $1.3 trillion spending bill
links.description: The Senate passed a massive $1.3 trillion spending bill in the early morning hours of Friday, sending it to President Donald Trump's desk for his signature. Congress approved the more than 2,200-page legislation swiftly with a midnight Friday government shutdown deadline looming. The plan was released only Wednesday night.

links.title: Asia's Response After Trump Announces Tariffs Against China
links.description: What may help markets find their feet in time is the continuing solid economic growth in the global economy. Central banks are also still supporting global liquidity -- the collective balance sheet of the key developed nations' central banks won't start shrinking until early 2019, according to Bloomberg Economics forecasts.
